messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] New at Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... No need to apologize :-)  I just wondered, because I used to moderate a large list in San Diego; it had a sudden influx of members when someone posted a
messages.messageBody:
on 3/17/03 6:19 PM, nanapro13 at nanapro13@... wrote:

> Nancy, this is how I got to the list. First, I went to Sandra Dodd
> on Unschooling, then to Radical Unschooling, then dropped down to
> AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com and then join the membership. I never
> saw anything that said it was an advanced group. But thats where it
> took me. I am sorry. Im not only new at unschooling also new at the
> computer.

No need to apologize :-) I just wondered, because I used to moderate a
large list in San Diego; it had a sudden influx of members when someone
posted a link to it from her website. It's interesting to me how people
find their homeschooling information.

Nancy

messages.subject: New at Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Nancy, this is how I got to the list. First, I went to Sandra Dodd on Unschooling, then to Radical Unschooling, then dropped down to
messages.messageBody:
Nancy, this is how I got to the list. First, I went to Sandra Dodd
on Unschooling, then to Radical Unschooling, then dropped down to
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com and then join the membership. I never
saw anything that said it was an advanced group. But thats where it
took me. I am sorry. Im not only new at unschooling also new at the
computer. My son started school at 4 in Headstart. Then at 5
kindergarden. At 6 first grade. At 7 second grade. Took him out at
the end of Jan. of this
year.
Brenda, Thanks a Million for your help. You told me everything I
need to here. This is going to be fun. I maybe 51 yrs old but can
still be a kid. What great excuse for getting out of housework. lol
I just wanted to say Thanks for the help I got today. Pam
